intro: Feuilleea oblonga, commonly known as the broadleaf fern, is a species native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Feuilleea oblonga is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal.
